envSetVal("layout" "extractVerifyInvalidConnections" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

extractVerifyMustConnectMarkers

layout extractVerifyMustConnectMarkers boolean { t | nil }

Description

Displays the must-connect violation markers generated by the connectivity extractor. When set to t, the extractor shows top-level must-connect violations in the layout window; when set to nil, it does not.

The default is t.

This environment variable is considered only when extractEnabled is switched on. It shows only violations at the current top level. Adjusting the extractStopLevel has no effect on the violations shown. To show markers at a lower level, you must edit the lower level cellview in place or run hierarchical extraction.

GUI Equivalent

Command

(In Layout XL) Options – Layout XL – Connectivity – Controls

Field

Verify must-connect violations

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "extractVerifyMustConnectMarkers")
envSetVal("layout" "extractVerifyMustConnectMarkers" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "extractVerifyMustConnectMarkers" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

extractVerifyOpenViolations

layout extractVerifyOpenViolations boolean { t | nil }

Description

Toggles the verification and display of open violations in the design.

This environment variable is considered only when extractEnabled is switched on.
To improve interactive performance for large designs or unrouted designs containing nets with a large number of instance terminals and terminals, use the extractCellviewOpenViolationLimit and extractNetOpenViolationLimit environment variables. They are considered only when extractVerifyOpenViolations is set to t.

GUI Equivalent

Command

(In Layout XL) Options – Layout XL – Connectivity – Controls

Field

Verify open violations

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "extractVerifyOpenViolations")
envSetVal("layout" "extractVerifyOpenViolations" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "extractVerifyOpenViolations" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

extractVerifyOpticalPortRadiusMatch

layout extractVerifyOpticalPortRadiusMatch boolean { t | nil }

Description

Checks if the radius of the overlapping optical ports match to form a valid connection.

The default value is nil.

GUI Equivalent

None.

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "extractVerifyOpticalPortRadiusMatch")
envSetVal("layout" "extractVerifyOpticalPortRadiusMatch" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "extractVerifyOpticalPortRadiusMatch" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

extractVerifyWellSubstrateConnections

layout extractVerifyWellSubstrateConnections boolean { t | nil }

Description

Enables or disables the verification of the substrate in terms of open and short violations. The tool only supports a single, global substrate for the design being edited. Therefore, this variable should not be turned on if the design has local substrates. The default is nil.

The tool does not support deep well layers either.

GUI Equivalent

None.

Examples

envSetVal("layout" "extractVerifyWellSubstrateConnections" 'boolean t)

Example 1: No open markers are created between two disjoint substrate vias on the same net because the vias short to each other through the substrate.

Example 2: A substrate short marker is created if a substrate via is created on a given net and placed over the substrate while the substrate is already polarized on another net by another substrate via.

envGetVal("layout" "extractVerifyWellSubstrateConnections")
envSetVal("layout" "extractVerifyWellSubstrateConnections" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "extractVerifyWellSubstrateConnections" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

extractVerifyUnimplementedInstTerms

layout extractVerifyUnimplementedInstTerms boolean { t | nil }

Description

Specifies that the connectivity extractor should consider instance terminals with pin shapes that are not extractable (including instance terminals with no pin shapes at all).

The default is t.

When set to nil, the extractor and the functions it serves ignore any instance terminal which has no pin shape or which has a pin shape on a layer that is not extractable. This allows Layout XL to extract based only on the extract layers defined in the technology file.

This environment variable is considered only when extractEnabled and extractVerifyOpenViolations are switched on.

GUI Equivalent

Command

(In Layout XL) Options – Layout XL – Connectivity – Controls

Field

Verify unimplemented instance terminall

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "extractVerifyUnimplementedInstTerms")
envSetVal("layout" "extractVerifyUnimplementedInstTerms" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "extractVerifyUnimplementedInstTerms" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

extractVerifyUnnecessaryPseudoParallelConnections

layoutXL extractVerifyUnnecessaryPseudoParallelConnections boolean { t | nil }

Description

Reports the overlap between two sub-nets of a pseudo-parallel net.

The default is nil.

GUI Equivalent

Command:

Options - Connectivity - Connectivity - Annotation

Field:

Unnecessary pseudo-parallel connections

(Annotations tab)

Examples

envGetVal("layoutXL" "extractVerifyUnnecessaryPseudoParallelConnections")

envSetVal("layoutXL" "extractVerifyUnnecessaryPseudoParallelConnections" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

extractVerifyWeakMarkers

layout extractVerifyWeakMarkers boolean { t | nil }

Description

Displays the weak-connect violation markers generated by the connectivity extractor. When set to t, the extractor shows top-level weak-connect violations in the layout window; when set to nil, it does not.

The default is t.

This environment variable is considered only when extractEnabled is switched on. It shows only violations at the current top level. Adjusting the extractStopLevel has no effect on the violations shown. To show markers at a lower level, you must edit the lower level cellview in place or run hierarchical extraction.

GUI Equivalent

Command

(In Layout XL) Options – Layout XL – Connectivity – Controls

Field

Verify weak-connect violations

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "extractVerifyWeakMarkers")
envSetVal("layout" "extractVerifyWeakMarkers" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "extractVerifyWeakMarkers" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

extractVirtualConnectionSeparator

layout extractVirtualConnectionSeparator string "virtualConnectSeparator"

Description

Specifies the separator that the connectivity extractor uses to identify virtual-connect labels.

By default, the virtual-connect separator is colon (:). But, you can change the separator, as appropriate, using the Use (identifier) to define nets as virtually connected field in the Layout XL Options form.

For more information on virtual-connect label separators, see Virtual Connections. For information on connectivity extraction from virtually connected shapes, see Enabling Virtual Connections.

The default is (“:”).

GUI Equivalent

Command

(In Layout XL) Options – Layout XL – Connectivity – Controls

Field

Use (identifier) to define nets as virtually connected (Layout XL Options form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "extractVirtualConnectionSeparator")
envSetVal("layout" "extractVirtualConnectionSeparator" 'string “:”)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

filterSizeForResolution

graphic filterSizeForResolution string {(High highVal) | (Medium medVal)| (Low lowVal)}

Description

Enables you to customize the level of details, filter size applied to resolutions High, and/or Medium, and/or Low.

By default, this environment variable is defined as below:

graphic filterSizeForResolution ‘string "(High 2.0) (Medium 6.0) (Low 15.0)”

The table below lists the different filter sizes used and the lowVal, MedVal, and HighVal values defined in the filterSizeForResolution environment variable.

Low

Medium

High

Very High

Shape filterSize

lowVal

(def 15.0)

medVal

(def 6.0)

highVal

(def 2.0)

0.0

Highest Resolution for P&R Objects option deselected

15.0

6.0

6.0

1.0

Highest Resolution for P&R Objects option selected

15.0

6.0

highVal

0.0

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Display

Field

Resolution (Display Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "filterSizeForResolution")
envSetVal{"graphic" "filterSizeForResolution" 'string {(High 3.0) | (Medium 7.0)| (Low 18.0)}

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

flattenExcludePcellListFile

layout flattenExcludePcellListFile string pathAndFileName

Description

Specifies the name of the file that contains the list of Pcells that should not be flattened. This file has a list of library, cell and view of Pcells. In case the file is not found, the Pcells are flattened and a warning message is displayed in the CIW. If the flattenPCells environment variable is set to nil, no Pcells are flattened and the no warning message is displayed in the CIW. If the flattenPCells environment variable is set to t, all Pcells except those specified in the file are flattened. A warning message is displayed for the Pcells specified in the file.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "flattenExcludePcellListFile")
envSetVal("layout" "flattenExcludePcellListFile" 'string "/project1/technology10/technology10.excludePcellListFile")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

flattenMode

layout flattenMode cyclic { one level | displayed levels | user level}

Description

Specifies the default number of levels of hierarchy of a cell to flatten in leHiFlatten() or leFlattenInst(). The default is one level.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Edit – Hierarchy – Flatten

Field

Hierarchy Level (Flatten Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "flattenMode")
envSetVal("layout" "flattenMode" 'cyclic "one level")
envSetVal("layout" "flattenMode" 'cyclic "displayed levels")
envSetVal("layout" "flattenMode" 'cyclic "user level")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

fullSelectionMode

graphic fullSelectionMode string { enclosed | crossed | enclosedAndCrossed }

Description

Specifies whether the full selection mode is set to crossed (crossed), enclosed (enclosed) or enclosed and crossed (enclosedAndCrossed). Crossed Figures fully selects objects you partially enclose with the area selection box, and does not select fully enclosed objects. Enclosed Figures fully selects objects you completely enclose with the area selection box. Enclosed and Crossed Figures fully selects objects you completely or partially enclose with the area selection box. The default is enclosed.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Selection

Field

Full Mode (Selection Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "fullSelectionMode")
envSetVal("graphic" "fullSelectionMode" 'string "enclosed")
envSetVal("graphic" "fullSelectionMode" 'string "crossed")
envSetVal("graphic" "fullSelectionMode" 'string "enclosedAndCrossed")

Related Topics

Specifies the aperture value when the snap distance between the pointer and an object (gravityDistance) is set to Medium. The default is 20.

The gravityApertureInPixels environment variable is applied only when the value of the gravityDistance environment variable set to Medium.

envGetVal("layout" "gravityApertureInPixels")

layout gravityDistance string { Small | Medium | Large | Very Large }

Description

Specifies the snap distance between the pointer and an object. You can choose from Small, Medium, Large, or Very Large. The default is Medium.

Field

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

gravityEditCellViewOnly

layout gravityEditCellViewOnly boolean { t | nil }

Description

Setting this environment variable to t implies gravity will work within current cellview only. Seting it to nil implies gravity will work outside the current cellview also. This environment variable is useful in EIP mode, when the current cellview is not the same as the window cellview.

The default is t.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "gravityEditCellViewOnly")
envSetVal("layout" "gravityEditCellViewOnly" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "gravityEditCellViewOnly" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

The default is nil.

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

grEnclosedBy

layout grEnclosedBy float float_number

Description

Initializes the Enclose by field on the Guard Ring form. The default value is 0.0. You can replace the default value with another integer point number by updating this environment variable in your .cdsenv file. You can change the value for the Enclose by field by typing in the field on the Guard Ring form. The software verifies that minSpacing is correct. It also verifies that it is minimum DRC compliant, based on process and context. If necessary, the software overrides the user value in the form.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – MPP Guard Ring

Field

Enclose by (Guard Ring Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "grEnclosedBy")
envSetVal("layout" "grEnclosedBy" 'float 2.0)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

iconsOn

layout iconsOn boolean { t | nil }
graphic iconsOn boolean { t | nil }

Description

Determines whether to display the elements in an un-expanded array as rectangles with the symbol for the master cell for each element. The variable applies to an instance or contact array. In the Display Options form set the display start and stop levels to 0. When iconsOn is t, selecting Show Name Of instance displays the instance name. When iconsOn is t, selecting Show Name Of master displays the master name.The layout default is nil, the graphic default is t.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Display

Field

Array Icons (Display Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "iconsOn")
envSetVal("layout" "iconsOn" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "iconsOn" 'boolean nil)
envGetVal("graphic" "iconsOn")
envSetVal("graphic" "iconsOn" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("graphic" "iconsOn" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

envGetVal("layout" "ignoreBounce")

ignoreParallelMinWidthForSquarePinResize

layout ignoreParallelMinWidthForSquarePinResize boolean { t | nil }

Description

For square pins, determines whether to ignore the minWidth constraint along the direction perpendicular to the WSP track.

The default value is nil.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "ignoreParallelMinWidthForSquarePinResize")
envSetVal("layout" "ignoreParallelMinWidthForSquarePinResize" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "ignoreParallelMinWidthForSquarePinResize" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

instanceDrawingMode

graphic instanceDrawingMode string { BBox | prBoundary | snapBoundary }

layout instanceDrawingMode string { BBox | prBoundary | snapBoundary }

Description

Determines whether the boundary of instances is displayed as the instance bounding box (BBox), the place and route boundary (prBoundary), or the snap boundary (snapBoundary). The default is BBox. This environment variable replaces the drawPRBoundary environment variable.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Display

Field

Instance Drawing Mode (Display Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "instanceDrawingMode")
envSetVal("graphic" "instanceDrawingMode" 'string "BBox")
envSetVal("graphic" "instanceDrawingMode" 'string "prBoundary")
envSetVal("graphic" "instanceDrawingMode" 'string "snapBoundary")
envGetVal("layout" "instanceDrawingMode")
envSetVal("layout" "instanceDrawingMode" 'string "BBox")
envSetVal("layout" "instanceDrawingMode" 'string "prBoundary")
envSetVal("layout" "instanceDrawingMode" 'string "snapBoundary")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

instanceSelectionMode

layout instanceSelectionMode cyclic { ignoreLPP | useLPP }

Description

Controls the selection of instances in the layout editor. You can set the environment variable to one of the following values:

  • ignoreLPP: Ignores the Selectability of the LPP instance drawing.
  • useLPP: The instance is selectable on the canvas if the LPP instance drawing has Selectability enabled in the Layers pane.

The default is ignoreLPP.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "instanceSelectionMode")
envSetVal("layout" "instanceSelectionMode" 'cyclic "ignoreLPP")
envSetVal("layout" "instanceSelectionMode" 'cyclic "useLPP")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

instanceVisibilityMode

layout instanceVisibilityMode cyclic { ignoreLPP | useLPP }

Description

Controls the visibility of instances in the layout editor. You can set the environment variable to one of the following values:

  • ignoreLPP: Ignores the Visibility of the LPP instance drawing.
  • useLPP: The instance is visible on the canvas if the LPP instance drawing has Visibility enabled in the Layers pane of the Palette Assistant.

The default is useLPP.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "instanceVisibilityMode")
envSetVal("layout" "instanceVisibilityMode" 'cyclic "ignoreLPP")
envSetVal("layout" "instanceVisibilityMode" 'cyclic "useLPP")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

instName

layout instName string any_cell_name

Description

Specifies one or more names for the instances you create. You can specify as many names as you want (separated by spaces). As each name is used, it is removed from the list. If all names are used, the function automatically generates a name based on the current master’s instNamePrefix property and puts it in the form field. The default is none.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – Instance

Field

Names (Create Instance Form)

Examples

envSetVal("layout" "instName" 'string "Inst1")

labelKeepLabel

Command

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

labelLPP

layout labelLPP cyclic { auto | currentLayer | sameLayer | selectLayer }

Description

Specifies the layer/purpose to use for creating labels. The default is currentLayer. This determines the layer to place the label from the stampLabelLayers section of the technology file.

currentLayer uses the layer/purpose set as the current entry layer in the Layers assistant.

sameLayer uses the layer of the object to be labeled.

selectLayer allows you to specify the layer/purpose from the drop-down list in the Create Label form.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – Label

Field

Label Layer/Purpose (Create Label Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "labelLPP")
envSetVal("layout" "labelLPP" 'cyclic "auto")
envSetVal("layout" "labelLPP" 'cyclic "currentLayer")
envSetVal("layout" "labelLPP" 'cyclic "sameLayer")
envSetVal("layout" "labelLPP" 'cyclic "selectLayer")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

lockAngles

layout lockAngles boolean { t | nil }

Description

Specifies that angles of partially selected shapes are not modified when the shapes are stretched. This option has no effect on instances or arrays. The default is t.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Field

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "lockAngles")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

lppVisibilityMode

layout lppVisibilityMode cyclic { checkValidity | donotCheckValidity }

Description

Controls the visibility of a layer purpose pair (LPP) based on its visibility and validity. When set to checkValidity, only the shapes on valid and visible LPPs are displayed in the design window. When set to donotCheckValidity, shapes on all visible LPPs are displayed in the design window, irrespective of the validity of the LPPs. The default is donotCheckValidity.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Display

Field

Set LPP Visibility Mode (Display Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "lppVisibilityMode")
envSetVal("layout" "lppVisibilityMode" 'cyclic "checkValidity")
envSetVal("layout" "lppVisibilityMode" 'cyclic "donotCheckValidity")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

magAnchorPosition

layout magAnchorPosition cyclic { top left corner | top right corner | bottom left corner | bottom right corner }

Description

Specifies where to position the magnifier with respect to the pointer position. By default, the magnifier appears at the top left corner of the design display area with respect to the pointer.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Magnifier

Field

Anchored at (Magnifier Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "magAnchorPosition")
envSetVal("layout" "magAnchorPosition" 'cyclic "top left corner")
envSetVal("layout" "magAnchorPosition" 'cyclic "top right corner")
envSetVal("layout" "magAnchorPosition" 'cyclic "bottom left corner")
envSetVal("layout" "magAnchorPosition" 'cyclic "bottom right corner")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

magConfined

layout magConfined boolean { t | nil }

Description

Keeps the magnifier within the design display area and always displays it completely. The default is t. If set to nil, the magnifier might not be visible completely if it is close to the edge of the design display canvas.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Magnifier

Field

Keep Within Window (Magnifier Options Form)

Examples

offset by (Magnifier Options Form)

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

magFloatPosition

layout magFloatPosition cyclic { Center | Position Magnfier }

Description

Enables you to customize the position of the magnifier. If you set the value to Center, the center of the magnifier coincides the pointer position. If you set the value to Position Magnifier, you can specify the magCursorOffset after setting the magOffsetCorner. The default setting is Position Magnifier.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Magnifier

Field

Not Anchored: Center, Position Magnifier (Magnifier Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "magFloatPosition")
envSetVal("layout" "magFloatPosition" 'cyclic "Center")
envSetVal("layout" "magFloatPosition" 'cyclic "Position Magnfier")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

envSetVal("layout" "makeCellCellType" 'cyclic "blockRing")
envSetVal("layout" "makeCellCellType" 'cyclic "cover")
envSetVal("layout" "makeCellCellType" 'cyclic "coverBump")
envSetVal("layout" "makeCellCellType" 'cyclic "pad")
envSetVal("layout" "makeCellCellType" 'cyclic "padSpacer")
envSetVal("layout" "makeCellCellType" 'cyclic "core")
envSetVal("layout" "makeCellCellType" 'cyclic "coreSpacer")
envSetVal("layout" "makeCellCellType" 'cyclic "coreAntenna")
envSetVal("layout" "makeCellCellType" 'cyclic "corner")
envSetVal("layout" "makeCellCellType" 'cyclic "softMacro")
envSetVal("layout" "makeCellCellType" 'cyclic "via")
envSetVal("layout" "makeCellCellType" 'cyclic "blockBlackBox")
envSetVal("layout" "makeCellCellType" 'cyclic "padAreaIO")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

markerAccessMode

graphic markerAccessMode cyclic { read | write }

Description

Specifies the mode, read or write, for opening a cellview. The default is write.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Verify – Markers – Find

Form Field

Cellview Access Mode (Find Marker Form)

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "markerAccessMode")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerAccessMode" 'cyclic "read")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerAccessMode" 'cyclic "write")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

markerDeleteAccessModeIsEdit

graphic markerDeleteAccessModeIsEdit boolean { t | nil }

Description

Enables you to specify whether you want to open the cellview in read or edit mode when deleting the markers. The default setting is t. In the default mode, the cellview is re-opened in edit mode for deleting markers. In this mode, you can additionally set markerDeleteConfirmModeChange to t to get a confirmation dialog box. If markerDeleteAccessModeIsEdit is nil, markers are deleted and the cellview remains in read mode.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Verify – Markers – Delete, Verify – Markers – Delete All

Field

Cellview Access Mode (Delete All Markers Form, Delete Marker Form)

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteAccessModeIsEdit")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteAccessModeIsEdit" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteAccessModeIsEdit" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

markerDeleteConfirmModeChange

graphic markerDeleteConfirmModeChange boolean { t | nil }

Description

Opens a dialog box that enables you to confirm whether or not the cellview(s) are to be re-opened in edit mode when you try to delete markers on the cellview(s) (Verify – Markers – Delete All). By default, the environment variable is set to nil. In this mode, markers are deleted and the cellviews are re-opened in edit mode with no dialog box. If set to t, a dialog box appears where you can specify all, none, or some cellviews to reopen in edit mode to delete markers on them. In this mode, markers are not deleted in cellviews that stay in read mode.

This environment variable has no effect if markerDeleteAccessModeIsEdit is set to nil.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Verify – Markers – Delete, Verify – Markers – Delete All

Field

Confirm Access Mode Change (Delete All Markers Form, Delete Marker Form)

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteConfirmModeChange")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteConfirmModeChange" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteConfirmModeChange" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

markerDeleteScope

graphic markerDeleteScope cyclic { cellview | hierarchy starting from top cellview | hierarchy starting from current cellview }

Description

Defines the scope of the deletion of markers. You can set the scope for deletion of markers from the current cellview, throughout the hierarchy, or throughout the hierarchy starting with the current cellview. By default, the environment variable is set to cellview.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Verify – Markers – Delete All

Field

Search Scope (Delete All Markers Form)

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteScope")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteScope" 'cyclic "cellview")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteScope" 'cyclic "hierarchy starting from top cellview")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteScope" 'cyclic "hierarchy starting from current cellview")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

markerDeleteSeverities

graphic markerDeleteSeverities string { info | acknowledgedWarning | warning | signedOffError | error | signedOffCriticalError | criticalError | fatalError }

Description

Defines the default severities. By default, the environment variable is set to info, acknowledgedWarning, warning, signedOffError, error, signedOffCriticalError, criticalError, and fatalError severities.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Verify – Markers – Delete All

Field

Severity (Delete All Markers Form)

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteSeverities")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteSeverities" 'string "info")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteSeverities" 'string "acknowledgedWarning")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteSeverities" 'string "warning")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteSeverities" 'string "signedOffError")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteSeverities" 'string "error")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteSeverities" 'string "signedOffCriticalError")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteSeverities" 'string "criticalError")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteSeverities" 'string "fatalError")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

markerDeleteSources

graphic markerDeleteSources string { VLS Connectivity:nil | Default:t }

Description

Defines the state of the sources. The string to be specified in the environment variable is tool name followed by its state t or nil. The tool name and state are seperated by a colon (:). Multiple tooks are separated by a comma. The Default key can be used to set the state of any other tool by default.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Verify – Markers – Delete All

Field

Sources: select (Delete All Markers Form)

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteSources")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteSources" 'string "VLS Connectivity:t")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

markerDeleteSourcesMode

graphic markerDeleteSourcesMode cyclic { all | select }

Description

Defines the source mode for deletion of markers. By default, the environment variable is set to all. The value allsignifies all markers that match the severities and scope criteria will be deleted. The value select signifies that a list of marker owners will be computed and only the sources that have been selected will be deleted.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Verify – Markers – Delete All

Field

Sources (Delete All Markers Form)

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteSourcesMode")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteSourcesMode" 'cyclic "all")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerDeleteSourcesMode" 'cyclic "select")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

markerSearchBy

graphic markerSearchBy cyclic { master | occurrences }

Description

Specifies which markers will display, markers in the master cell only (master) or all occurrences of markers (occurences). The default is occurrences.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Verify – Markers – Find

Form Field

Find by (Find Marker Form)

Examples

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

markerSeverity

graphic markerSeverity string { fatalError | criticalError | signedOffCriticalError | error | signedOffError | warning | acknowledgedWarning | info | annotation }

Description

Specifies the types of warnings and errors to be searched for and highlighted in a design. Replace list with one or more of the following values, separated by white space: fatalError, criticalError, signedOffCriticalError, error, signedOffError, warning, acknowledgedWarning, info, annotation. Set markerSeverity to all or both to display all types of markers. Set the environment variable to none to switch off marker display.

The default is none.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Verify – Markers – Find

Field

Severity (Find Marker Form)

Examples

envSetVal("graphic" "markerSeverity" ’string "info fatalError warning")

Searches for and displays markers of type info, fatalError, and warning.

envGetVal("graphic" "markerSeverity")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerSeverity" 'string "fatalError")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerSeverity" 'string "criticalError")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerSeverity" 'string "signedOffCriticalError")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerSeverity" 'string "error")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerSeverity" 'string "signedOffError")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerSeverity" 'string "warning")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerSeverity" 'string "acknowledgedWarning")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerSeverity" 'string "info")
envSetVal("graphic" "markerSeverity" 'string "annotation")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

graphic markerZoom boolean { t | nil }

Determines whether to zoom to the next or previous marker while using the schematic editor’s Find Marker form. Does not apply to the layout editor. The default is nil.

markNetExcludePurposes

layout markNetExcludePurposes boolean { t | nil }

Determines whether to exclude the specified purposes from tracing. The default purpose values that are listed are annotate, boundary, error, flight, label, and warning. You can delete any of the default purpose values. The default is t.

markNetHilightObj

layout markNetHilightObj boolean { t | nil }

Description

Sets the Mark Net command to display the traced connectivity after every 10,000 shapes are processed. The default is nil.

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

markNetNumThreads

layout markNetNumThreads int integer_number

Description

Controls the chaser thread mode of the Mark Net command. If you set this environment variable to an integer less than or equal to 0, the Mark Net command runs in auto mode. If you set the value to 1, the Mark Net command runs in single thread mode. If you set the value to an interger greater than 1, the Mark Net command runs in custom thread mode.

The default value of this environment variable is 0.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "markNetNumThreads")
envSetVal("layout" "markNetNumThreads" 'int 5)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

markNetOptionsFile

layout markNetOptionsFile string <dir-path/filename>

Description

Specifies the path to the markNetOptions file to be read when a new Virtuoso session is started. You can specify the absolute file path or only the filename. The file path can be specified using Unix shell environment variables such as $HOME and $PWD; for example, $HOME/myMarkNetOptions or $PWD/myMarkNetOptions.

If you specify only the filename, the file is looked up using the Cadence Search File (CSF) mechanism.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Connectivity – Nets – Mark – Options

Field

Save/Load custom settings for Via, Connected and Stop Layers (MarkNet Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "markNetOptionsFile")
envSetVal("layout" "markNetOptionsFile" 'string "markNetOptions")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

markNetRange

layout markNetRange cyclic { Top to bottom | Current to bottom | Top to current |Top to stop level | Current to stop level | User defined }

Description

Sets the hierarchical range that the Mark Net command uses to determine which nets will highlight and which will not. Top to bottom makes available all nets in the entire hierarchy of the cellview for marking. Current to bottom makes available the nets in the hierarchy from the current level of hierarchy to the Display Level To field in the Display Options form (stop level) for marking. Top to current makes available the nets in the hierarchy from the top level to the current level of hierarchy for marking. Top to stop level makes available the nets in the hierarchy from the top level to the level defined as the stop level. Current to stop level makes available the nets in the hierarchy from the current level to the level defined as the stop level. User defined makes available the nets in a numerical hierarchical range for marking in conjunction with markNetStartLevel and markNetStopLevel. The default is Top to bottom.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Connectivity – Nets – Mark – Options

Field

Hierarchy Range (MarkNet Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "markNetRange")
envSetVal("layout" "markNetRange" 'cyclic "Top to bottom")
envSetVal("layout" "markNetRange" 'cyclic "Current to bottom")
envSetVal("layout" "markNetRange" 'cyclic "Top to current")
envSetVal("layout" "markNetRange" 'cyclic "Top to stop level")
envSetVal("layout" "markNetRange" 'cyclic "Current to stop level")
envSetVal("layout" "markNetRange" 'cyclic "User defined")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

Enables via shapes to be saved in the cellview created by running the Connectivity – Nets – Save All Mark Nets command. The default is nil.

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

maskLayoutDefaultApp 

graphic maskLayoutDefaultApp string registered_application

Description

Automates the launching of a default application for cellviews of type maskLayout.

This environment variable is ignored when launching Layout XL from a schematic window. In this case, the layout view always opens in Layout XL. This environment variable setting is also ignored when descending into or editing-in-place in the same view type.
To apply this setting, the environment variable saveViewSubType must be set to nil, otherwise the Layout cellview automatically opens in the same application in which it was last saved.

GUI Equivalent

Command

File – Set Default Application

Field

Set default application for all layout cellviews to (Set Default Application Form)

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "maskLayoutDefaultApp")
envSetVal("graphic" "maskLayoutDefaultApp" 'string "Layout XL")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

maxAutoStoreSelectionObj

graphic maxAutoStoreSelectionObj int integer_number

Description

Sets the maximum number of selected elements with a selection set for the Max number of selected elements within a set field on the Selection Options form, accessed by choosing Options – Selection. If the number of elements in the selection exceeds this number, the selection set is not kept. The default is 100.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Selection

Field

Max number of selected elements within a set (Selection Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "maxAutoStoreSelectionObj")
envSetVal("graphic" "maxAutoStoreSelectionObj" 'int 80)

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

Field

Max number of Stored sets (Selection Options Form)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

maxPathSegInSpineAreaSelection

graphic maxPathSegInSpineAreaSelection int integer_number

Description

Controls the maximum number of pathsegs up to which spine can be computed. If the number of pathsegs exceeds the environment variable setting, the spine, comprising the pathsegs, is not computed. Setting this variable appropriately helps prevent performance issues. The default is 10000.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "maxPathSegInSpineAreaSelection")
envSetVal("graphic" "maxPathSegInSpineAreaSelection" 'int 9000)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

mergeScope

layout mergeScope cyclic { pcells | except current | all }
graphic mergeScope cyclic { pcells | except current | all }

Description

Specifies the hierarchies for which the Enable Merge command applies.

  • pcells: All the Pcells in the hierarchy including the current cellview
  • except current: All the hierarchies except the current cellview
  • all: All the hierarchies including the current cellview

The default is pcells.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Display

Field

Scope (Display Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "mergeScope")
envSetVal("layout" "mergeScope" 'cyclic "pcells")
envSetVal("layout" "mergeScope" 'cyclic "except current")
envSetVal("layout" "mergeScope" 'cyclic "all")
envGetVal("graphic" "mergeScope")
envSetVal("graphic" "mergeScope" 'cyclic "pcells")
envSetVal("graphic" "mergeScope" 'cyclic "except current")
envSetVal("graphic" "mergeScope" 'cyclic "all")

envSetVal("layout" "mppTemplate" 'string "cellTechLibName.mpp.templates.il")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

mustConnectAllPins 

layout mustConnectAllPins boolean { t | nil }

Description

Determines whether the LEF58_MUSTJOINALLPORTS property is to be applied to all newly created pin terminals in the layout, which implies that the router must connect all pins of the selected terminal. This setting is applicable only when Connectivity in the Create Pin form is set to Weak.

The default value is nil, in which case the property is not applied.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – Pin

Field

Must Connect All Pins (Create Pin Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "mustConnectAllPins")
envSetVal("layout" "mustConnectAllPins" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "mustConnectAllPins" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

multiThreadInfo

graphic multiThreadInfo boolean { t | nil }

Description

Displays information messages about the number of threads running when redrawing the canvas. The number of threads varies according to the display resolution. The default is nil.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "multiThreadInfo")
envSetVal("graphic" "multiThreadInfo" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("graphic" "multiThreadInfo" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

muteUnstretchableOption

layout muteUnstretchableOption boolean { t | nil }

Description

Lets you control whether to display a dialog box when you attempt to stretch multiple figures and only some of the figures in the selected set can be legally stretched. When set to nil, a form opens to let you choose whether to stretch only the legally stretchable figures within the selected set or to cancel the stretch command. When set to t, no form appears, and you are only able to stretch the legally stretchable figures; figures that cannot legally be stretched do not stretch. The default value is t.

For example: When this variable is set to nil, you partially select three rectangles, and your stretch would cause one rectangle to have zero area, a dialog box appears, stating that one shape in the selected set will not be stretched. You can click OK to stretch the two stretchable rectangles and leave the un-stretchable rectangle un-stretched, or you can cancel the command.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "muteUnstretchableOption")
envSetVal("layout" "muteUnstretchableOption" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "muteUnstretchableOption" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

layout netBasedSelectionNetName string { the_name_of_the_net }

graphic netBasedSelectionNetName string { the_name_of_the_net }

Description

Specifies the name of the nets for which the shapes, vias, and instances can be selected. You can specify the name of a single net or multiple nets separated by a space.

netExprDisplay

graphic netExprDisplay string { value only | value (default) | value [property] | value [expression] | expression only }

Description

Specifies how to display inherited connections values. The value is what the connection resolves to; if it is overridden at a higher level in the hierarchy, the full path to a local signal might be displayed. The default is expression only.

netNameDisplayFilter

graphic netNameDisplayFilter boolean { t | nil }

Description

Controls the selective display of net name labels. This means, depending on the filter mode selected, the specified nets have their name labels either shown or hidden in the layout canvas.

The default is nil, which means all nets have their labels displayed.

netNameDisplayFontStyle

graphic netNameDisplayFontStyle string { "euroStyle" | "gothic" | "math" | "roman" | "script" | "stick" | "fixed" | "swedish" | "raster" | "milSpec" | "serif" | "sansSerif" | "mono" | "serifItalic" | "serifBold" | "serifBoldItalic" | "sansBold" | "sansLight" | "nil" }

Description

Sets the font style to use for displaying the net name label.

The default is "stick".

The font style that you set using the environment variable applies only for the current session.

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

openToStopLevel

layout openToStopLevel boolean { t | nil }
graphic openToStopLevel boolean { t | nil }

Description

Determines when the cellview data is loaded during rendering. When set to t all data is loaded to the window stop level (corresponding to the displayStopLevel variable), then rendered. All data is loaded, even data too small to see. When set to nil data loads on demand during rendering, to the filterSize limit. This can slightly slow initial redraw, zooms or pans, but will dramatically reduce the amount of data loaded, since data too small to see is not rendered. The default is t.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Display

Field

Open To Stop Level (Display Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "openToStopLevel")
envSetVal("layout" "openToStopLevel" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "openToStopLevel" 'boolean nil)
envGetVal("graphic" "openToStopLevel")
envSetVal("graphic" "openToStopLevel" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("graphic" "openToStopLevel" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

orientation

layout orientation cyclic { R0 | R90 | R180 | R270 | MY | MYR90 | MX | MXR90 }

Description

Specifies the incremental orientation with which objects are placed during creation or editing, with an initial setting of R0. This environment variable corresponds to the Rotate, Sideways, and Upside Down buttons on any form. It resets to R0 after each usage, so you can use it only to set an orientation bindkey. Each time you press the bindkey the value specified is added to whichever one of the eight legal orientations the object is currently in (R0, R90, R180, R270, MY, MYR90, MX, or MXR90). Therefore, this variable is only used as a relative value. The default is R0.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "orientation")
envSetVal("layout" "orientation" 'cyclic "R0")
envSetVal("layout" "orientation" 'cyclic "R90")
envSetVal("layout" "orientation" 'cyclic "R180")
envSetVal("layout" "orientation" 'cyclic "R270")
envSetVal("layout" "orientation" 'cyclic "MY")
envSetVal("layout" "orientation" 'cyclic "MYR90")
envSetVal("layout" "orientation" 'cyclic "MX")
envSetVal("layout" "orientation" 'cyclic "MXR90")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

originMarkersOn

layout originMarkersOn boolean { t | nil }
graphic originMarkersOn boolean { t | nil }

Description

Determines whether the cell origins are displayed when viewing the bounding boxes of cell instances (t), or not (nil). The origins appear as plus signs. The default is t.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Display

Field

Instance Origins (Display Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "originMarkersOn")
envSetVal("layout" "originMarkersOn" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "originMarkersOn" 'boolean nil)
envGetVal("graphic" "originMarkersOn")

envSetVal("graphic" "originMarkersOn" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

overrideFontName 

layout overrideFontName string "font_name"
graphic overrideFontName string "font_name"

Description

Specifies fonts that override the default fonts. Supported font choices are euroStyle, gothic, math, roman, script, stick, fixed, swedish, raster, milSpec, serif, sansSerif, mono, serifItalic, serifBold, serifBoldItalic, sansBold, and sansLight.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "overrideFontName")
envSetVal("layout" "overrideFontName" 'string "(stick sansLight) (gothic raster)" )
envGetVal("graphic" "overrideFontName")
envSetVal("graphic" "overrideFontName" 'string "(stick sansLight) (gothic raster)" )

In the above example, the second pair of font replaces the first one.

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

partialSelect

envGetVal("layout" "partialSelect")

envSetVal("graphic" "partialSelect" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

partialSelectProximityMaxPixel

graphic partialSelectProximityMaxPixel int integer_number

Description

Overrides the current shape selection behavior. Setting this variable, will enable you to select the entire shape by clicking anywhere on the center line or by selecting an edge, when partial select is on and you are zoomed in at the shape end. The default value is 60. To override current selection behavior, set this value to 5.

If you want to select a vertex, the distance between the vertex and the cursor should be less than the value you set here.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "partialSelectProximityMaxPixel")
envSetVal("graphic" "partialSelectProximityMaxPixel" 'int 50)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

partialSelectionMode

graphic partialSelectionMode string { vertexAndEdge | enclosedEdge | crossedEdge | enclosedAndCrossed}

Description

Specifies whether the partial selection mode is set to vertex and edge (vertexAndEdge), enclosed edge (enclosedEdge) or crossed edge (crossedEdge), or enclosed and crossed (enclosedAndCrossed). Vertex (vertexAndEdge) fully selects all objects you completely enclose with the area selection box, vertices of any objects you partially select with the area selection box, and edges of any objects you enclose with the area selection box. Enclosed Edges (enclosedEdge) fully selects all objects you completely enclose with the area selection box, and the edges of any objects you partially enclose with the area selection box. Crossed Edges (crossedEdge) selects the edges of any objects you enclose with the area selection box, and does not select fully enclosed objects. Enclosed and Crossed Edges (enclosedAndCrossed) fully selects all objects you completely enclose with the area selection box, the vertices of any objects you partially enclose with the area selection box, and the edges of any objects you enclose with the area selection box. The default is vertexAndEdge.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Selection

Field

Partial Mode (Selection Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "partialSelectionMode")
envSetVal("graphic" "partialSelectionMode" 'string "vertexAndEdge")
envSetVal("graphic" "partialSelectionMode" 'string "enclosedEdge")
envSetVal("graphic" "partialSelectionMode" 'string "crossedEdge")
envSetVal("graphic" "partialSelectionMode" 'string "enclosedAndCrossed")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pasteRef

layout pasteRef cyclic { origin | lowerLeft | lowerCenter | lowerRight | centerLeft | centerCenter | centerRight | upperLeft | upperCenter | upperRight | user specified}

Description

Specifies the reference point of the bounding box when pasting. You can select one of the ten reference points when pasting. The reference points are origin, lowerLeft, centerLeft, upperLeft, lowerCenter, centerCenter, upperCenter, lowerRight, centerRight, upperRight, and user specified.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Edit – Basic – Paste

Field

Reference Points (Paste Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pasteRef")
envSetVal("layout" "pasteRef" 'cyclic "origin")
envSetVal("layout" "pasteRef" 'cyclic "lowerLeft")
envSetVal("layout" "pasteRef" 'cyclic "lowerCenter")
envSetVal("layout" "pasteRef" 'cyclic "lowerRight")
envSetVal("layout" "pasteRef" 'cyclic "centerLeft")
envSetVal("layout" "pasteRef" 'cyclic "centerCenter")
envSetVal("layout" "pasteRef" 'cyclic "centerRight")
envSetVal("layout" "pasteRef" 'cyclic "upperLeft")
envSetVal("layout" "pasteRef" 'cyclic "upperCenter")
envSetVal("layout" "pasteRef" 'cyclic "upperRight")
envSetVal("layout" "pasteRef" 'cyclic "user specified")

Related Topics

envSetVal("layout" "pinMode" 'cyclic "Auto")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pinSelectionMode

layout pinSelectionMode cyclic { ignoreLPP | useLPPIncludeShapes | useLPPExcludeShapes }

Description

Determines the selectability of pins and shapes.

  • If set to ignoreLPP, pins are selectable if the Pin check box in the Objects assistant is selected.
  • If set to useLPPIncludeShapes, instance pins are selectable if the Pin check box in the Object pane is selected and the LPP of the shape corresponding to the instance pin is set to selectable in the Layer pane.
  • If set to useLPPExcludeShapes, instance pins are selectable only if the Pin check box in the Object pane is selected. The LPP of the shape corresponding to the instance pin is not considered.

The default is useLPPIncludeShapes.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pinSelectionMode")
envSetVal("layout" "pinSelectionMode" 'cyclic "ignoreLPP")
envSetVal("layout" "pinSelectionMode" 'cyclic "useLPPIncludeShapes")
envSetVal("layout" "pinSelectionMode" 'cyclic "useLPPExcludeShapes")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pinTextLayerNames

Description

Specifies the layer names used to filter the Layer Names for the Set Pin Label Text Style form.

The default is "".

If the layer names to be used for the filter are not specified, or none of the specified layer names match a valid layer name, all the valid layers are used.

GUI Equivalent

None

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pinTextSameLayer

layout pinTextSameLayer boolean { t | nil }

Description

Determines whether to create the pin name label on the same layer/purpose as the pin being created or create it on the layer specified by pinTextLayer and the purpose specified by pinTextPurpose. When set to t, creates the pin name label on the same layer/purpose as the pin being created. When set to nil, the pin name is created on the layer specified by pinTextLayer and the purpose specified by pinTextPurpose. The default is nil.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – Pin – Create Label – Options – Set Pin Label Text Style

Field

Layer Name: Same As Pin (Set Pin Label Text Style Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pinTextSameLayer")
envSetVal("layout" "pinTextSameLayer" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "pinTextSameLayer" 'boolean nil)

layout pinTextOrientation cyclic { RO | R90 | R180 | R270 | MY | MYR90 | MX | MXR90}

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pointSelectAperture

graphic pointSelectAperture int integer_number

Description

Sets the number of pixels for aperture for the Point Selection Mode field on the Selection Options form, accessed by choosing Options – Selection. The aperture defines a box around the point inferred by a mouse click to consolidate unintentional pointer movements between two clicks due to a jittery hand. Two clicks within the aperture are treated as a double click the same point. The default is 5 pixels.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Selection

Field

Point Selection Controls: User Aperture Mode (Selection Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "pointSelectAperture")
envSetVal("graphic" "pointSelectAperture" 'int 7)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

preservePinFigs

layout preservePinFigs boolean { t | nil }

Description

Specifies whether the figure of the pin is preserved when the instance is flattened. When set to t, the figure moves up to the top level without any connectivity information; when set to nil, no figure is preserved and there is no connectivity. The default is t.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Edit – Hierarchy – Flatten

Field

Preserve: Pin geometries (Flatten Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "preservePinFigs")
envSetVal("layout" "preservePinFigs" 'boolean t)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

preserveTerminalContacts

layout preserveTerminalContacts boolean { t | nil }

Description

Setting this environment variable to t means that the terminal contacts will be preserved when you abut devices in Layout XL.The default is nil.

To preserve properties on a single instance, create a boolean property called preserveTerminalContacts with a value of t on the instance in question. This lets you preserve properties (and therefore contacts) on selected instances while dropping them for all other instances.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "preserveTerminalContacts")
envSetVal("layout" "preserveTerminalContacts" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "preserveTerminalContacts" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

preserveTermName

layout preserveTermName boolean { t | nil }

Description

Specifies whether the terminal name of the pin is preserved when the instance is flattened. When set to t, the terminal name of the pin is preserved when the instance is flattened. When set to nil, the instance name is added as a prefix to the terminal name of the pin when the instance is flattened. The default is nil.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Edit – Hierarchy – Flatten

Field

Preserve: Term name (Flatten Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "preserveTermName")
envSetVal("layout" "preserveTermName" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "preserveTermName" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

envSetVal("graphic" "probeFilledInstance" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

probeFilledInstanceParam

graphic probeFilledInstanceParam int integer

Description

Sets the transparency level when probing. The value 0 signifies that probe is fully transparent and the value 1000 signifies that probe is not transparent.The default is 500.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "probeFilledInstanceParam")
envSetVal("graphic" "probeFilledInstanceParam" 'int 100)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

probeHighlight

graphic probeHighlight boolean { t | nil }

Description

Determines whether the probes will be drawn with probe highlight or not. The default is t.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Highlight

Field

Highlight Color (Highlight Options Form)

Examples

envSetVal("graphic" "probeHighlight" 'boolean nil)

probeNetDisplayFlightLines

graphic probeNetDisplayFlightLines string { physical | logical }

Description

Specifies whether the probe flightlines show physical or logical connectivity.

  • physical specifies that all shapes and opens on the probed net are highlighted
  • logical specifies that segments linking all pins on the probed net are highlighted.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Highlight

Field

Flightlines (Highlight Options Form)

Examples

envSetVal("graphic" "probeNetDisplayFlightLines" 'string "physical")

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteAllLayersScope 

layout pteAllLayersScope cyclic { lswLayers | techfileLayers | nil }

Description

Defines the scope of layer-purpose pairs to be displayed in the Layers panel. When set to lswLayers, only the layer-purpose pairs defined in the LSW information file are displayed in the Layers panel. When set to techfileLayers, only the layer-purpose pairs defined in the technology file are displayed in the Layers panel.

Default is lswLayers.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Palette Menu – Options

Field

Scope of 'All Layers’ Layer Set (Palette Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteAllLayersScope")
envSetVal("layout" "pteAllLayersScope" 'cyclic "lswLayers")
envSetVal("layout" "pteAllLayersScope" 'cyclic "techfileLayers")
envSetVal("layout" "pteAllLayersScope" 'cyclic "nil")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteApplyParentState

layout pteApplyParentState boolean { t | nil }

Description

Toggles between the synchronized and desynchronized states of parent and child objects in the Objects and Grids panels.

By default, the environment variable is set to t, which is the synchronized mode. In this mode, when the visibility or selectability of a parent object is changed, the visibility and selectability of child objects is reset to coincide with that of the parent object.

To switch to the desynchronized mode, set the environment variable to nil.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Palette Menu – Options

Field

Visibility and selectability reset by parent

Sync visibility/selectability by parent (Palette Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteApplyParentState")
envSetVal("layout" "pteApplyParentState" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "pteApplyParentState" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteAutoRedrawMode

layout pteAutoRedrawMode cyclic { currentWindow | noWindow | allWindows }

Description

Determines the scope of the auto redraw feature.

When set to currentWindow, the current window canvas is updated in real time whenever a change is made to a Palette panel.

When set to noWindow, the auto redraw feature is turned off. As a result, manual redraw is needed to update all windows.

When set to allWindows, all synchronized window canvases are updated in real time, whenever a change is made to a Palette panel.

The default value is currentWindow.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Palette Menu – Options

Field

Auto Redraw (Palette Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteAutoRedrawMode")
envSetVal("layout" "pteAutoRedrawMode" 'cyclic "currentWindow")
envSetVal("layout" "pteAutoRedrawMode" 'cyclic "noWindow")
envSetVal("layout" "pteAutoRedrawMode" 'cyclic "allWindows")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteCheckableColumnClickMode

layout pteCheckableColumnClickMode cyclic { turnOnOff | sort }

Description

Determines the behavior when the Validity (V), Selectability (S), or Membership (m) columns in the Layers panel is clicked.

When set to turnOnOff, the statuses toggle between the on and off modes.

When set to sort, the layers are sorted based on their validity, selectability, or membership statuses.

The default value is turnOnOff.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Palette Menu – Options

Field

Checkable Column Click

Header Column Click (Palette Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteCheckableColumnClickMode")
envSetVal("layout" "pteCheckableColumnClickMode" 'cyclic "turnOnOff")
envSetVal("layout" "pteCheckableColumnClickMode" 'cyclic "sort")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteColoredLppSortOrder

layout pteColoredLppSortOrder string string_value

Description

Specifies the order in which colored layer-purpose pairs are listed within each master layer-purpose pair grouping. The default value is "".

You can use a space, a comma (,), a semicolon (;), a hyphen (-), a forward slash (/), a period (.), or an underscore (_) to separate the values in string_value.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteColoredLppSortOrder")
envSetVal("layout" "pteColoredLppSortOrder" 'string "metal1 drawing")

Causes a right-click in the Layers panel to display the context-sensitive Palette menu if set to nil. If set to t, a right-click in the Layers panel turns on or off the selectability of a layer-purpose pair. The default is t.

pteFindModeOn

layout pteFindModeOn boolean { t | nil }

Description

Toggles between the Filter and Find search modes.

When set to t, the Find mode is switched on. When set to nil, the Filter mode is switched on.

The default value is nil.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Field

Search Mode (Palette Options Form)

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteIncludeCutLayers

layout pteIncludeCutLayers boolean { t | nil }

Description

Controls the inclusion and exclusion of cut layers as routing layers. When set to t, cut layers are included as routing layers. When set to nil, cut layers are excluded from routing layers. The default is t.

GUI Equivalent

None

pteInfraDefValueObjGrids

Description

Sets the visibility and selectability of objects and grids. The default value is "".

This environment variable does not take effect if typed in CIW in your current session. Exit and then restart a new virtuoso session after setting this environment variable in the .cdsinit/.cdsenv file.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteInfraDefValueObjGrids")

pteInverseColorScheme

layout pteInverseColorScheme boolean { t | nil }

Description

When set to t, inverses the color scheme of the Palette panels. The default value is nil.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Palette Menu – Options

Field

Inverse color scheme (Palette Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteInverseColorScheme")
envSetVal("layout" "pteInverseColorScheme" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "pteInverseColorScheme" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteLayerSetActivationMode

layout pteLayerSetActivationMode cyclic { filterOnly | filterAndApply | filterVisSelectability }

Description

Determines the default action when one or more layer sets are selected.

When set to filterOnly, displays all layer-purpose pairs present in the selected layer sets. The visibility and selectability status of the layer-purpose pairs remains unchanged.

When set to filterAndApply, displays all layer-purpose pairs present in the selected layer sets. The visibility and selectability status of layer-purpose pairs is reset to that defined in the layer set files.

When set to filterVisSelectability, displays all layer-purpose pairs present in the selected layer sets. The visibility and selectability of all layer-purpose pairs is turned on.

The default value is filterOnly.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Palette Menu – Options

Field

Layer Set Activation (Palette Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteLayerSetActivationMode")
envSetVal("layout" "pteLayerSetActivationMode" 'cyclic "filterOnly")
envSetVal("layout" "pteLayerSetActivationMode" 'cyclic "filterAndApply")
envSetVal("layout" "pteLayerSetActivationMode" 'cyclic "filterVisSelectability")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteLayerSetManagerLeftClickMode

layout pteLayerSetManagerLeftClickMode cyclic { activateLayerSet | forceVisibilityAndSelectabilityOnly }

Description

Determines the default left mouse button click behavior for layer sets.

When set to activateLayerSet, the selected layer is activated. The visibility and selectability statuses for the selected layer are automatically turned on.

When set to forceVisibilityAndSelectabilityOnly, the selected layer set is activated and the visibility and selectability statuses of the constituent layers is forcibly turned on. The visibility and selectability statuses of all other layers are forcibly turned off.

The default value is activateLayerSet.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Palette Menu – Options

Field

Layer Set Manager Left Click (Palette Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteLayerSetManagerLeftClickMode")
envSetVal("layout" "pteLayerSetManagerLeftClickMode" 'cyclic "activateLayerSet")
envSetVal("layout" "pteLayerSetManagerLeftClickMode" 'cyclic "forceVisibilityAndSelectabilityOnly")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteLayersSelectabilityDepth

layout pteLayersSelectabilityDepth int integer_value

Description

Sets the selectability depth for layers. The depth value determines the number of layer-purpose pairs for which the selectability attribute is affected when you hold down Ctrl or both Ctrl and Shift and right-click a layer-purpose pair in the Layers panel. The default value is 1.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Palette Menu – Options

Field

Selectability Depth For Layers

Depth for Selectability (Palette Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteLayersSelectabilityDepth")
envSetVal("layout" "pteLayersSelectabilityDepth" 'int 3)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteLayersVisibilityDepth

layout pteLayersVisibilityDepth int integer_value

Description

Sets the visibility depth for layers. The depth value determines the number of layer-purpose pairs for which the visibility attribute is affected when you hold down Ctrl or both Ctrl and Shift and click in the Layers panel a layer-purpose pair with the middle mouse button. The default value is 1.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Palette Menu – Options

Field

Visibility Depth For Layers

Depth for Visibility (Palette Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteLayersVisibilityDepth")
envSetVal("layout" "pteLayersVisibilityDepth" 'int 3)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteLinkColorVisibilityToShapeVisibility

layout pteLinkColorVisibilityToShapeVisibility boolean { t | nil }

Description

Controls the visibility of colored shapes. When set to t, colored shapes become invisible if you deselect the Visibility (V) check box corresponding to the layer-purpose pairs on which they are drawn. When set to nil, only the colored outline is hidden; the shapes remain visible.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Palette Menu – Options

Field

Shape visibility by color visibility (Palette Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteLinkColorVisibilityToShapeVisibility")
envSetVal("layout" "pteLinkColorVisibilityToShapeVisibility" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "pteLinkColorVisibilityToShapeVisibility" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteLppsDisplayOrderControl

layout pteLppsDisplayOrderControl cyclic { palette | techfile }

Description

Causes the Palette LPPs Display Order check box to be selected or deselected. When set to techfile, the default value, the check box is deselected, and when set to palette, the check box is selected.

When this environment variable is set to palette, you can change the display order of layer-purpose pairs in the canvas by dragging up and down the layer-purpose pairs listed in the Palette.

Palette must be set to Multi-select mode.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options - Layout Editor Options

Options – Editor

Field

Palette LPPs Display Order (Layout Editor Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteLppsDisplayOrderControl")
envSetVal("layout" "pteLppsDisplayOrderControl" 'cyclic "palette")
envSetVal("layout" "pteLppsDisplayOrderControl" 'cyclic "techfile")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables’

pteLSManagerAsAssistant

layout pteLSManagerAsAssistant boolean { t | nil }

Description

Enables the layer set manager as an assistant. The default value is nil.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteLSManagerAsAssistant")
envSetVal("layout" "pteLSManagerAsAssistant" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "pteLSManagerAsAssistant" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteLSManagerRespectFilters

layout pteLSManagerRespectFilters boolean { t | nil }

Description

When set to t, the + and – buttons in the Layer Set Manager, which are used to turn on and turn off the visibility or selectability status of the layers present in a layer set, work with respect to the filter settings defined on the Scope and Filter toolbars. The Scope toolbar provides three options for filtering layers, namely, Valid, Used, and Routing. The Filter toolbar enables you to define search criteria for filtering layers.

For example, if you select the Valid check box on the Scope toolbar, and click the + button in the Layer Set Manager to turn on the visibility of a layer set, then visibility is turned on for only the valid layers of the layer set. It does not affect the visibility setting of the invalid layers.

The default value is nil.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteLSManagerRespectFilters")
envSetVal("layout" "pteLSManagerRespectFilters" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "pteLSManagerRespectFilters" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteMPTMode

layout pteMPTMode boolean { t | nil }

Description

Determines if the Palette MPT feature is turned on or off at the time of opening a new layout window.

If set to nil, which is the default, the Palette MPT feature is disabled. If set to t, the MPT check box is displayed on the Scope toolbar and the Color (C) column is displayed in the Layers panel when you open a new layout window.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteMPTMode")
envSetVal("layout" "pteMPTMode" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "pteMPTMode" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteMPTScope

layout pteMPTScope boolean { t | nil }

Description

Controls the setting of the MPT check box at the time of opening a new layout window and is evaluated only if the pteMPTMode environment variable is set to t.

If set to nil, which is the default, the MPT check box is deselected and all layer-purpose pairs are listed in the in the Layers panel. If set to t, the MPT check box is selected and only the layer-purpose pairs with more than one color are listed in the Layers panel.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteMPTScope")
envSetVal("layout" "pteMPTScope" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "pteMPTScope" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteMovableTools

layout pteMovableTools boolean { t | nil }

Description

Specifies whether the toolbars can be moved in the workspace. The default value is nil.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Palette Menu – Options

Field

Movable tools (Palette Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteMovableTools")
envSetVal("layout" "pteMovableTools" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "pteMovableTools" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteMultiSelectionMode

layout pteMultiSelectionMode boolean { t | nil }

Description

Toggles between the single-selection and multi-selection mode. When set to t, multi-selection mode is turned on. When set to nil, single-section mode is turned on. The default value is nil.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Palette Menu – Options

Field

Multi-select mode (Palette Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteMultiSelectionMode")
envSetVal("layout" "pteMultiSelectionMode" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "pteMultiSelectionMode" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteRetainFilterSettings

layout pteRetainFilterSettings boolean { t | nil }

Description

When set to t, synchronizes the setting of the Scope filters, namely Valid, Used, Routing, and MPT, across synchronized layout windows.

For example, if you apply the Routing filter by selecting the Routing check box in one layout window, it is automatically applied to all open layout windows, and also to those that are opened subsequently, as long as the windows stay synchronized.

The default value is nil.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteRetainFilterSettings")
envSetVal("layout" "pteRetainFilterSettings" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "pteRetainFilterSettings" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteRoutingOnlyScope

layout pteRoutingOnlyScope boolean { t | nil }

Description

When set to t, only routing layers are displayed in the Layers panel. The default value is nil.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Layers Panel

Field

Routing

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteRoutingOnlyScope")
envSetVal("layout" "pteRoutingOnlyScope" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "pteRoutingOnlyScope" 'boolean nil)
