List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteShowMPTScope

layout pteShowMPTScope boolean { t | nil }

Description

Hides the MPT check box if set to nil. The default value is t.

The MPT check box is displayed on the Scope toolbar when you enable MPT Support.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteShowMPTScope")
envSetVal("layout" "pteShowMPTScope" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "pteShowMPTScope" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteShowUsedSystemLpps

layout pteShowUsedSystemLpps boolean { t | nil }

Description

When set to t, on the application of the Used filter, the Layers panel displays layers containing all types of design objects. The default value is nil, which implies that, by default, the Layers panel displays only the layers containing design objects of type shape.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteShowUsedSystemLpps")
envSetVal("layout" "pteShowUsedSystemLpps" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "pteShowUsedSystemLpps" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteUsedLayersEipScope 

layout pteUsedLayersEipScope cyclic { currentToBottom | topToBottom }

Description

When set to currentToBottom, layers used in the design at the current hierarchy level and below are listed in the Layers panel. When set to topToBottom, all layers used in the design are listed in the Layers panel. The default is currentToBottom.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Palette Menu – Options

Field

Scope of Used Layers in EIP (Palette Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteUsedLayersEipScope")
envSetVal("layout" "pteUsedLayersEipScope" 'cyclic "currentToBottom")
envSetVal("layout" "pteUsedLayersEipScope" 'cyclic "topToBottom")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

pteWindowSynchronizationMode

layout pteWindowSynchronizationMode cyclic { independent | synchronized }

Description

Sets the synchronization mode for new windows to either independent or synchronized. The default value is synchronized.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Palette Menu – Options

Field

Window Synchronization

Keep windows synchronized (Palette Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "pteWindowSynchronizationMode")
envSetVal("layout" "pteWindowSynchronizationMode" 'cyclic "independent")
envSetVal("layout" "pteWindowSynchronizationMode" 'cyclic "synchronized")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

QAHoldTimeMilliSec

layout QAHoldTimeMilliSec int integer_number

Description

Enables you to specify the time (in milliseconds) required to hold the pointer over an object. While using the Quick Align command, if the pointer remains stationary over an object for longer than the specified time, the potential points, edges, and centerlines in the object are highlighted. The default value is 0.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "QAHoldTimeMilliSec")
envSetVal("layout" "QAHoldTimeMilliSec" 'int 100)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

QAMaxPixelsPerMilliSec

layout QAMaxPixelsPerMilliSec int integer_number

Description

Defines the maximum velocity with which the pointer should move between potential targets for the Quick Align command to be able to snap to them. If the pointer moves with the velocity higher than the value defined in the QAMaxPixelsPerMilliSec environment variable, the Quick Align command does not snap to those targets.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "QAMaxPixelsPerMilliSec")
envSetVal("layout" "QAMaxPixelsPerMilliSec" 'int 10)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

quickAlignMode

layout quickAlignMode cyclic { MoveOrStretch | Copy }

Description

Specifies the mode to be used for alignment.

  • MoveOrStretch: The object is moved or stretched during alignment.
  • Copy: The object is copied during alignment.

The default value is MoveOrStretch.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Edit – Quick Align

Field

Move/Stretch, Copy

Copy reference (Quick Align Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "quickAlignMode")
envSetVal("layout" "quickAlignMode" 'cyclic "MoveOrStretch")
envSetVal("layout" "quickAlignMode" 'cyclic "Copy")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

quickAlignSameLayerTarget

layout quickAlignSameLayerTarget boolean { t | nil }

Description

Snaps the pointer to only those targets that are on the same layer as the object with the reference point, edge, or centerline. When set to nil, the pointer snaps to edges, centerlines, and points on a target object on any layer if they are within the aperture distance from the pointer. The default value is nil.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Edit – Quick Align

Field

On Same Layer (Quick Align Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "quickAlignSameLayerTarget")
envSetVal("layout" "quickAlignSameLayerTarget" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "quickAlignSameLayerTarget" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

quickAlignSnapTarget

layout quickAlignSnapTarget cyclic { Edges and Points | Edges | Points }

Description

Specifies the method to enable the pointer to the reference set and target object.

  • Edges and Points: Snaps the pointer to edges, centerlines, vertices, nexus, and end points in the reference set and target object.
  • Edges: Snaps the pointer to only the edges and centerlines in the reference set and target object.
  • Points: Snaps the pointer to vertices, midpoint of edges, nexus, end points, and origin point of objects in reference set and target.

The default value is Edges and Points.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Edit – Quick Align

Field

Snap Target (Quick Align Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "quickAlignSnapTarget")
envSetVal("layout" "quickAlignSnapTarget" 'cyclic "Edges and Points")
envSetVal("layout" "quickAlignSnapTarget" 'cyclic "Edges")
envSetVal("layout" "quickAlignSnapTarget" 'cyclic "Points")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

quickAlignSpacingType

layout quickAlignSpacingType cyclic { none | min | user }

Description

Specifies the spacing between the reference edge, centerline, or point and the target edge, centerline, or point after the alignment.

  • none: No spacing is applied.
  • min: The minSpacing value of the reference object layer is applied.
  • user: A user-specified spacing value is applied. Specify the value by using the environment variable quickAlignUserSpacing.

The default value is none.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Edit – Quick Align

Field

No Spacing, Min Spacing, User Spacing (Quick Align Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "quickAlignSpacingType")
envSetVal("layout" "quickAlignSpacingType" 'cyclic "none")
envSetVal("layout" "quickAlignSpacingType" 'cyclic "min")
envSetVal("layout" "quickAlignSpacingType" 'cyclic "user")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

quickAlignUserSpacing

layout quickAlignUserSpacing float float_number

Description

Specifies the user-defined spacing value between the reference edge, centerline, or point and the target edge, centerline, or point after the alignment. The default value is 0. You can specify an integer.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Edit – Quick Align

Field

User Spacing (Quick Align Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "quickAlignUserSpacing")
envSetVal("layout" "quickAlignUserSpacing" 'float 1.0)

Related Topics

Examples

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

rectOnSnapPatternGrid

layout rectOnSnapPatternGrid boolean { t | nil }

Description

When enabled, the first point of the rectangle snaps correctly to the appropriate track enclosure line. This implies when you create a rectangle downwards in the cellview, the first point snaps to the upper track enclosure line. When you create a rectangle upwards in the cellview, the first point snaps to lower track enclosure line. To specify the second point correctly, you are guided by the DRD discrete dimension markers. The discrete dimension markers appear only if discrete dimension is enabled and the allowedWidthRanges constraint is specified in the technology file. The default value is nil.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "rectOnSnapPatternGrid")
envSetVal("layout" "rectOnSnapPatternGrid" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "rectOnSnapPatternGrid" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

layout rectSmartSnapEnable boolean { t | nil }

Description

Specifies whether the rectangle is to be created with smart snapping. The default value is nil.

envSetVal("layout" "removeEmptyNetTerm" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "removeEmptyNetTerm" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

removeTerminals

layout removeTerminals cyclic { never | always | noInstTermsOnNet }

Description

Controls the deletion of the terminal associated with a pin when the pin is deleted.

  • never: The terminal will not be deleted.
  • always: The terminal will be deleted if it has no pin figure.
  • noInstTermsOnNet: The terminal will be deleted if there is no instTerm and pin figure on the terminal.

The default is noInstTermsOnNet.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "removeTerminals")
envSetVal("layout" "removeTerminals" 'cyclic "never")
envSetVal("layout" "removeTerminals" 'cyclic "always")
envSetVal("layout" "removeTerminals" 'cyclic "noInstTermsOnNet")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

replaceFigs

layout replaceFigs boolean { t | nil }

Description

Specifies whether selected figures are replaced with a new cell created from the selected figures (t), or not (nil). This setting is used by leHiMakeCell and leMakeCell. The default is t.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Edit – Hierarchy – Make Cell

Field

Replace selected figures (Make Cell Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "replaceFigs")
envSetVal("layout" "replaceFigs" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "replaceFigs" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

resetOrientation

layout resetOrientation boolean { t | nil }

Description

Specifies whether the Move or Copy commands or SKILL code using leHiMove or leHiCopy resets orientation to 0 prior to the move or copy (t), or retains the specified orientation as set by the orientation environment variable (nil). Terminating the Move or Copy command always resets orientation to 0. The default is t.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "resetOrientation")
envSetVal("layout" "resetOrientation" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "resetOrientation" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

rowAbutNumberOfUnits

layout rowAbutNumberOfUnits int any_integer_greater_than_zero

Description

Sets the value of the data entry field for the Abut option in the Definition section of the Create – P&R Objects – Row form to specify how many rows you want to abut. The valid values are any integer greater than zero. The default value is 2. To specify a value for this data entry field, the Abut option must be set to t. You can set the Abut option with the rowAbutUnit environment variable.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – P&R Objects – Row

Field

Options: Abut: rows (Create Row Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "rowAbutNumberOfUnits")
envSetVal("layout" "rowAbutNumberOfUnits" 'int 10)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

rowAbutUnit

layout rowAbutUnit boolean { t | nil }

Description

Sets the Options: Abut check box in the Definition section of the Create – P&R Objects – Row form to abut a specified number of rows. The valid values are t and nil. The default value is nil. When the Abut option is set to t, you can set the number of rows for the data entry field next to the Abut option with the rowAbutNumberOfUnits environment variable.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – P&R Objects – Row

Field

Options: Abut (Create Row Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "rowAbutUnit")
envSetVal("layout" "rowAbutUnit" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "rowAbutUnit" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

rowBaseName

layout rowBaseName string any_string

Description

Sets the Base Name field in the Definition section of the Create – P&R Objects – Row form to assign a unique name for each row object you create. The software adds an underscore followed by a number which is greater than or equal to 1. As you create new sites, each site is increment by 1. For example, if your base name is ROW_1, the name assigned to the first site is ROW_1_1, the next is ROW_1_2, the next is ROW_1_3, and so on. If you do not specify a base name, the software assigns the name row_number, which increments by 1 each time you add a site and rows.

The default value is "".

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – P&R Objects – Row

Field

Base Name (Create Row Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "rowBaseName")
envSetVal("layout" "rowBaseName" 'string "row1")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

rowCreateMethod

layout rowCreateMethod cyclic { "assisted" | "define" | "partition" | "rectilinear" }

Description

Determines the create method for rows. The assisted mode will not take into account any areas or boundaries. You can create rows that use a rectangular, rectilinear, or a partitioned area to determine the number and placement of the rows

The default value is assisted.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – P&R Objects – Row

Field

Create Method (Create Row Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "rowCreateMethod")
envSetVal("layout" "rowCreateMethod" 'cyclic "assisted")
envSetVal("layout" "rowCreateMethod" 'cyclic "define")
envSetVal("layout" "rowCreateMethod" 'cyclic "partition")
envSetVal("layout" "rowCreateMethod" 'cyclic "rectilinear")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

rowChannelWidth

layout rowChannelWidth float float_number

Description

Sets the Options: Channel Width data entry field in the Definition section of the Create – P&R Objects – Row form to specify the space between the rows you create. If you specify to abut rows (with rowAbutUnit or in the form), Channel Width is overridden. The default value is 0.0 in user units.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – P&R Objects – Row

Field

Options: Channel Width (Create Row Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "rowChannelWidth")
envSetVal("layout" "rowChannelWidth" 'float 1.0)

Related Topics

envSetVal("layout" "rowNumberOfSites" 'int 5)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

rowSiteEnable 

layout rowSiteEnable boolean { t | nil }

Description

When t, instances will snap to the nearest site within a row. The instance must be either over a legal row or the distance between the instance and the legal row must be within the specified aperture in Layout Editor Options form. The default is nil. The priority of snapping is as follows:

  • snap boundary: if the instance has a snap boundary, the snap boundary will snap to the row site.
  • prBoundary: if the instance has a prBoundary but no snap boundary, the prBoundary will snap to the row site.
  • cellview: if the instance neither has a snap boundary nor a prBoundary, then the lower left corner of the instance will snap to the row site.
If you are creating or editing an instance and rowSiteEnable is set to t, rowSiteEnable takes precedence over snapToGrid for snapping of the instance.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Editor

Field

Instance to Row (Layout Editor Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "rowSiteEnable")
envSetVal("layout" "rowSiteEnable" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "rowSiteEnable" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

rowUnitOrient

layout rowUnitOrient cyclic { "R0" | "R90" | "R180" | "R270" | "MX" | "MY" | "MXR90" | "MYR90" }

Description

Sets the Starting Site Orientation cyclic field in the Definition section of the Create – P&R Objects – Row form to set the orientation of the site and the first row created. All subsequent rows will follow the orientation you set in this field. The valid values are R0, R90, R180, R270, MX, MY, MXR90, and MYR90. The default value is RO.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – P&R Objects – Row

Field

Starting Site Orientation (Create Row Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "rowUnitOrient")
envSetVal("layout" "rowUnitOrient" 'cyclic "R0")
envSetVal("layout" "rowUnitOrient" 'cyclic "R90")
envSetVal("layout" "rowUnitOrient" 'cyclic "R180")
envSetVal("layout" "rowUnitOrient" 'cyclic "R270")
envSetVal("layout" "rowUnitOrient" 'cyclic "MX")
envSetVal("layout" "rowUnitOrient" 'cyclic "MY")
envSetVal("layout" "rowUnitOrient" 'cyclic "MXR90")
envSetVal("layout" "rowUnitOrient" 'cyclic "MYR90")

Related Topics

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

rulerSegmentModeType

layout rulerSegmentModeType cyclic ( Single | Multiple | Auto )

Description

Specifies the type of ruler created by the measurement. You can set the environment variable to one of the following values:

  • Single: Creates a single-segment ruler. This is the measurement between points on the canvas.
  • Multiple: Creates a multiple-segment ruler. In this mode, you can view the measurement between consecutive points that you specify.
  • Auto: Creates a multiple-segment ruler. In this mode, points are automatically calculated. There are two ways in which the ruler is created in the auto mode:
    • An auto ruler is created between two specified points on the canvas.
    • You press the Shift key in the auto mode. In this case, an orthogonal ruler is created with all edges visible on the canvas in vertical or horizontal direction. In this case, the direction of the ruler is based on the edge closest to the pointer.

The default value is Single.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Tools – Create Measurement

Field

Segment Mode (Create Measurement Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "rulerSegmentModeType")
envSetVal("layout" "rulerSegmentModeType" 'cyclic "Single")
envSetVal("layout" "rulerSegmentModeType" 'cyclic "Multiple")
envSetVal("layout" "rulerSegmentModeType" 'cyclic "Auto")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

layout saveACopyLibName string any_library_name

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

segSnapMode

layout segSnapMode string { orthogonal | diagonal | anyAngle | horizontal | vertical }
graphic segSnapMode string { orthogonal | diagonal | anyAngle | horizontal | vertical }

Description

Determines how Edit command entry points snap to the grid. The layout default is orthogonal, the graphic default is anyAngle.

anyAngle is not a valid value for the Create Wire (XL, GXL) command.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Display

Field

Snap Modes: Edit (Display Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "segSnapMode")
envSetVal("layout" "segSnapMode" 'cyclic "orthogonal")
envSetVal("layout" "segSnapMode" 'cyclic "diagonal")
envSetVal("layout" "segSnapMode" 'cyclic "anyAngle")
envSetVal("layout" "segSnapMode" 'cyclic "horizontal")
envSetVal("layout" "segSnapMode" 'cyclic "vertical")
envGetVal("graphic" "segSnapMode")
envSetVal("graphic" "segSnapMode" 'cyclic "orthogonal")
envSetVal("graphic" "segSnapMode" 'cyclic "diagonal")
envSetVal("graphic" "segSnapMode" 'cyclic "anyAngle")
envSetVal("graphic" "segSnapMode" 'cyclic "horizontal")
envSetVal("graphic" "segSnapMode" 'cyclic "vertical")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

selectCreatedObj

layout selectCreatedObj boolean { t | nil }

Description

Determines whether or not an object remains selected after its creation. If set to t, all objects you create are selected after creation. Any object selected before starting the create command also remain selected. The default is nil.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Editor

Field

Select Created Object (Layout Editor Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "selectCreatedObj")
envSetVal("graphic" "selectCreatedObj" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("graphic" "selectCreatedObj" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

selectionAperture

layout selectionAperture int any_positive_integer
graphic selectionAperture int any_positive_integer

Description

Creates a selection aperture box around the pointer with the specified number of pixels. A setting of 5 will create a square of 6 by 6 pixels, which includes the center pixel. When a point is clicked the pointer will select the closest object contained within the aperture area. The next click will select the second closest object contained within the aperture area, and so on. Only one object is selected with each click. When no more objects are contained within the aperture area that have not already been selected, the pointer will cycle back to the first object selected. and each subsequent click will repeat the selection order. The default is 5.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "selectionAperture")
envSetVal("layout" "selectionAperture" 'int 10)
envGetVal("graphic" "selectionAperture")
envSetVal("graphic" "selectionAperture" 'int 10)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

selectMarkersAtLast

graphic selectMarkersAtLast boolean { t | nil }

Description

Selects markers at last, after the shapes even if the the marker edge is closer than the shape edge or markers and shapes overlap. The default is nil.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "selectionAperture")
envSetVal("layout" "selectionAperture" 'int 10)
envGetVal("graphic" "selectionAperture")
envSetVal("graphic" "selectionAperture" 'int 10)

Related Topics

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

selectOnlyInstWithSelectableShapes

layout selectOnlyInstWithSelectableShapes boolean { t | nil }

Description

Determines whether instances are selectable. If t an instance is selected only if Instances is selected in the Objects assistant and the instance or instances contain shapes that are on selectable layers. If nil an instance or instances are selected when the Instances option is on, even if none of the shapes within them are on selectable layers. The default is nil.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "selectOnlyInstWithSelectableShapes")
envSetVal("layout" "selectOnlyInstWithSelectableShapes" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "selectOnlyInstWithSelectableShapes" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

setupConstraintGroup

layout setupConstraintGroup string any_valid_constraint_group

Description

Specifies the default set of legal interconnect layers which Virtuoso XL (virtuosoDefaultExtractorSetup) use for connectivity extraction. A custom constraint group can have user defined names (myRoutingLayers). A constraint group must minimally contain valid interconnect layers, and may optionally include a list of valid vias.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "setupConstraintGroup")
envSetVal("layout" "setupConstraintGroup" 'string "x y z")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

slotEdgeToSlotOffset

Description

Specifies the distance between the slot edge and the shape edge. The default value is 1.0.

Examples

envSetVal("layout" "slotEdgeToSlotOffset" 'float 3.0)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

slotWarnWhenMoreThanRows

layout slotWarnWhenMoreThanRows int integer_number

Description

Displays a warning message in the CIW if you try to create a rectangle or a path with more slot rows than specified by this environment variable. You can create a rectangle or a path with more slot rows than the number specified, but the slots do not appear in the drag set while creating the rectangle or path if the slot rows exceed the specified number.

The default value of this environment variable is 1000.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – Slot, Edit – Advanced – Slot, Create – Shape – Rectangle, Create – Shape – Path

Field

NA

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "slotWarnWhenMoreThanRows")
envSetVal("layout" "slotWarnWhenMoreThanRows" 'int 1500)

snapMode

layout snapMode string { orthogonal | diagonal | anyAngle | L90XFirst | L90YFirst }
graphic snapMode string { orthogonal | diagonal | anyAngle | L90XFirst | L90YFirst }

Description

Determines how Create command entry points snap to the grid. The layout default is orthogonal, the graphic default is anyAngle.

anyAngle is not a valid value for the Create Wire (XL, GXL) command.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Display

Field

Snap Modes: Create (Display Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "snapMode")

envSetVal("layout" "snapMode" 'string "diagonal")
envSetVal("layout" "snapMode" 'string "anyAngle")
envSetVal("layout" "snapMode" 'string "L90XFirst")
envSetVal("layout" "snapMode" 'string "L90YFirst")
envGetVal("graphic" "snapMode")
envSetVal("graphic" "snapMode" 'string "orthogonal")
envSetVal("graphic" "snapMode" 'string "diagonal")
envSetVal("graphic" "snapMode" 'string "anyAngle")
envSetVal("graphic" "snapMode" 'string "L90XFirst")
envSetVal("graphic" "snapMode" 'string "L90YFirst")

snapPatternDrawingStyle

layout snapPatternDrawingStyle cyclic { full | tracks | boundary | periods | periodsAndTracks }

Description

Determines whether you see the boundary, the tracks, the fins, and periods (full) or the boundary and the tracks (tracks), or just the boundary (boundary) for snap patterns, or periods (periods), or periods and tracks (periodsandTracks) for width spacing patterns. The default is full.

Command

Field

envSetVal("layout" "snapPatternDrawingStyle" 'cyclic "periods")
envSetVal("layout" "snapPatternDrawingStyle" 'cyclic "periodsAndTracks")

snapPatternGlobalGridAnchoring

graphic snapPatternGlobalGridAnchoring boolean { t | nil }

Description

Determines whether the snap pattern global grid anchoring is enabled (t) or not (nil).

This environment variable applies only to newly created cellviews. Once a cellview is created, the setting of this environment variable is retained. To view or edit the setting after the cellview is created, you can use the functions, dbSetGlobalGridOffsetReferenceType and dbGetGlobalGridOffsetReferenceType.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "snapPatternGlobalGridAnchoring")
envSetVal("graphic" "snapPatternGlobalGridAnchoring" 'boolean t)

snapPatternSnappingDepth

layout snapPatternSnappingDepth int integer_number

Description

Lets you specify the snap depth for snap pattern snapping. The default value is 32.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "snapPatternSnappingDepth")
envSetVal("layout" "snapPatternSnappingDepth" 'int 20)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

snapPatternSnappingDepthMethod

layout snapPatternSnappingDepthMethod cyclic { DisplayPlusOne | UserDefined }

Description

Determines the method to be used to define the snap depth for snap pattern snapping. If the snapPatternSnappingDepthMethod is set to DisplayPlusOne, the value display stop level + 1 is used as the snap depth. If the snapPatternSnappingDepthMethod is set to UserDefined, the snap depth specified by the environment variable snapPatternSnappingDepth is used.The default value is DisplayPlusOne.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "snapPatternSnappingDepthMethod")
envSetVal("layout" "snapPatternSnappingDepthMethod" 'cyclic "DisplayPlusOne")
envSetVal("layout" "snapPatternSnappingDepthMethod" 'cyclic "UserDefined")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

tapLayerFilter

layout tapLayerFilter string { list_of_any_valid_layers }

Description

Filters layers to be tapped. The layers names must be separated by a space.and enclosed in quotation marks; for example, "metal1 metal2"

The default is "".

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "tapLayerFilter")
envSetVal("layout" "tapLayerFilter" 'string "metal1 metal2")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

tapPurposeList

layout tapPurposeList string { list_of_any_valid_layer_purposes }

Description

Prioritizes the order in which tap cycles through layers. When you set Wire Auto Tap or Shape Auto Tap to on, and Select from Overlaps to off, the tap purpose list is used to prioritize the order in which layers are cycled through during tap. When Wire Auto Tap and Shape Auto Tap are set to off and Select from Overlaps is on, the Choose object to tap from form appears, so the Tap Purpose List is not considered. The default is drawing.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Editor

Field

Tap Purpose List (Layout Editor Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "tapPurposeList")
envSetVal("layout" "tapPurposeList" 'string "metal1 drawing")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

tapType

layout tapType string { layer | net | attribute }

Description

Sets what information is obtained from tapping. When set to layer, the tap command sets the entry layer to the layer of the object on which you have tapped. When set to net, the tap command captures the net names of rectangles, polygons and paths. When set to attribute, the tap command captures the path net name, beginning and ending extension in user units, the path end type, and the path width, for trls, bends and tapers the tap command captures the bend factor (maximum width before they are chamfered), taper style (linear or exponential), number of points to taper in user units, the bend style (bend chamfer or radial), the width of a chamfered bend in a transmission line as a multiple of its standard width in user units, the number of segments in a radial bend in a transmission line as a function of the number of segments in a 180-degree radial bend, the radius of a radial bend in a transmission line as a multiple of the transmission-line width in user units, the width of the first end of a transmission line bend in user units, the width of the second end of a transmission line bend, and the width of the second end of a transmission line bend in user units.

Tapping of nets is only supported in the layout editor XL and GXL applications.

The default is layer.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Tools – Tap

Field

Layer, Net, Attributes (Tap Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "tapType")
envSetVal("layout" "tapType" 'string "layer")
envSetVal("layout" "tapType" 'string "net")
envSetVal("layout" "tapType" 'string "attribute")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

layout targetColor string color

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

termName

layout termName string any_terminal_name

Description

Specifies one or more names for terminals on which pins are created. You can specify as many names as you want (separated by spaces). As each name is used, it is removed from the list. If all names are used, the field in the Pin form becomes empty, and you cannot create any more pins until you specify a terminal name. The default is none.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – Pin

Field

Terminal Names (Create Pin Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "termName")
envSetVal("layout" "termName" 'string "term1")

Examples

envSetVal("layout" "trimEnable" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "trimEnable" 'boolean nil)
envGetVal("graphic" "trimEnable")
envSetVal("graphic" "trimEnable" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("graphic" "trimEnable" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

trlBendFac

layout trlBendFac float float_number

Description

Specifies the maximum width (as a multiple of its standard width) that standard bends in a transmission line can achieve before they are automatically chamfered. This attribute is used only for bend, style bend. The default is 1.0 user units.

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

useDynamic HilightPacket

graphic useDynamicHilightPacket boolean { t | nil }

layout useDynamicHilightPacket boolean { t | nil }

Description

Creates the dynamicHilight display packet (t) and uses it to draw dynamic highlights in the design. When set to nil, the dynamic highlight is drawn with a nonconfigurable thin dashed outline. The default is t for layout, nil for others.

When the environment variable is set to t, and you do not have the dynamicHilight display packet defined in the display.drf file, then the packet is created internally on the first dynamically highlighted figure. However, this packet is not saved automatically in display.drf. Therefore, if you close Virtuoso at this stage, display.drf is not modified, and next time, you open Virtuoso and then DRE, the dynamicHilight display packet will not be displayed.

However, if you open DRE, save display.drf, and then, close Virtuoso, the next time you will open Virtuoso and DRE, the dynamicHilight displaypacket will be present, even if environment variable is set to nil.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("graphic" "useDynamicHilightPacket")
envSetVal("graphic" "useDynamicHilightPacket" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("graphic" "useDynamicHilightPacket" 'boolean nil)
envGetVal("layout" "useDynamicHilightPacket")
envSetVal("layout" "useDynamicHilightPacket" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "useDynamicHilightPacket" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

useTapPurposeList

layout useTapPurposeList boolean { t | nil }

Description

Prioritizes the order in which tap cycles through layers. When you set Wire Auto Tap or Shape Auto Tap to on, and Select from Overlaps to off, the tap purpose list is used to prioritize the order in which layers are cycled through during tap. When Wire Auto Tap and Shape Auto Tap are set to off and Select from Overlaps is on, the Choose object to tap from form appears, so the Tap Purpose List is not considered. The default is t.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "useTapPurposeList")
envSetVal("layout" "useTapPurposeList" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "useTapPurposeList" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

useTrueBBox

layout useTrueBBox boolean { t | nil }
graphic useTrueBBox boolean { t | nil }

Description

Specifies how instance outlines at the display stop level are determined for display. When set to t, one more level of hierarchy opens. If the instance’s master contains a shape on the layer purpose "instance" "drawing", its bounding box displays as the outline. If the instance contains no shape on the layer purpose "instance" "drawing", the instance’s master bounding box displays. Opening the master ensures an accurate display of the outline, but can affect loading and display time. When set to nil, the current instance bounding box displays without opening any additional hierarchy. This enables large designs to open and display much faster.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Options – Display

Field

Display Controls: Use True BBox (Display Options Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "useTrueBBox")
envSetVal("layout" "useTrueBBox" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "useTrueBBox" 'boolean nil)
envGetVal("graphic" "useTrueBBox")
envSetVal("graphic" "useTrueBBox" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("graphic" "useTrueBBox" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

envSetVal("layout" "viaAutoViaEnableMaxStackDepth" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

viaAutoViaEnclosureDirection

layout viaAutoViaEnclosureDirection cyclic {"XY" | "wire" | "minArea" | "horizontal" | "vertical"}

Description

Specifies the preferred enclosure direction for the via engine in auto mode as either XY, wire, minArea, horizontal, or vertical. This environment variable defines the way enclosures are set on the via when there are minOppositeExtension rules in the technology file.

  • XY: Spcifies the X and Y coordiates of the via in the left right and top bottom direction. For example, ( minOppExtension "Metal1" "Via1" (0.0 0.03) ). This rule means that the Metal1 enclosure around Via1 should be 0.0 in one direction and 0.03 in the other (opposite) direction.
  • wire: The wire associated to the via is queried and if found, its direction is used to compute the enclosure direction, the higher enclosure value in the wire direction. For example, if the via Metal1-Metal2 connect two vertical pathsegs, the wire direction is vertical, thus 0.03 will be applied in Y (top/bottom) and 0 in X (left/right) for both the layers. In case the via connect two orthogonal pathsegs, the direction of the Metal1 pathseg is used to determine the enclosure direction for the rule, ( minOppExtension "Metal1" "Via1" (0.0 0.03) ), and the Metal2 pathseg for the rule, ( minOppExtension "Metal2" "Via1" (0.0 0.03) ).
  • minArea: The enclosure direction is chosen to minimize the via area for each layer. Depending on the size of the cutBox , the enclosure will be applied in onedirection or the other. For example, for a 1x10 via (big via in X, small in Y) the 0.03 in ( minOppExtension "Metal1" "Via1" (0.0 0.03) )will be applied in X because it leads to a smaller area of Metal1 than setting the 0.03 in Y.
  • horizontal: The higher enclosure value in the horizontal direction. In the example, ( minOppExtension "Metal1" "Via1" (0.0 0.03) ), 0.03 is applied in left/right coordinates and 0 is applied in top/bottom coordinates.
  • vertical: The higher enclosure value in the vertical direction. In the example, ( minOppExtension "Metal1" "Via1" (0.0 0.03) ), 0.03 is applied in top/bottom coordinates and 0 is applied in left/right coordinates.

The default is minArea.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "viaAutoViaEnclosureDirection")
envSetVal("layout" "viaAutoViaEnclosureDirection" 'cyclic "XY")
envSetVal("layout" "viaAutoViaEnclosureDirection" 'cyclic "wire")
envSetVal("layout" "viaAutoViaEnclosureDirection" 'cyclic "minArea")
envSetVal("layout" "viaAutoViaEnclosureDirection" 'cyclic "horizontal")
envSetVal("layout" "viaAutoViaEnclosureDirection" 'cyclic "vertical")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

viaCheckUserSet

layout viaCheckUserSet boolean { t | nil }

Description

Lets retain user specified parameters during via editing. When this environment variable is set to t, the Property Editor checks which via parameters are user specified and which have values based on the design rules. When this environment variable is set to nil, the Property Editor considers that all via parameters are user specified. So, when you change one via parameter, the other parameters do not change.

The default is nil.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "viaCheckUserSet")
envSetVal("layout" "viaCheckUserSet" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "viaCheckUserSet" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

viaComputeFromMode

layout viaComputeFromMode cyclic { "Row/Col" | "Width/Height" | "Shape(s)" | "Drawn Area" }

Description

Enables you to create auto vias at the intersection of shapes in the Single and Stack modes.

In the Single and Stack modes: You can select a Via Definition and specify the Row and Column Spacing, Width and Height, Shape(s) or, Drawn Area for the via. In the Stack mode, you can also specify the Start Layer and the End Layer of the via stack. So you can pre-define the viaDefs that will be used for each stacked via. The default is Row/Col.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – Via

Field

Compute From (Create Via Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "viaComputeFromMode")
envSetVal("layout" "viaComputeFromMode" 'cyclic "Row/Col")
envSetVal("layout" "viaComputeFromMode" 'cyclic "Width/Height")
envSetVal("layout" "viaComputeFromMode" 'cyclic "Shape(s)")
envSetVal("layout" "viaComputeFromMode" 'cyclic "Drawn Area")

envSetVal("layout" "viaCutClassOrientation" 'cyclic "Vertical")
envSetVal("layout" "viaCutClassOrientation" 'cyclic "Horizontal")
envSetVal("layout" "viaCutClassOrientation" 'cyclic "Auto")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

viaEnableUserSkillCallbacks

layout viaEnableUserSkillCallbacks boolean { t | nil }

Description

Controls the creation of a via based on SKILL callbacks. If the user callback returns t, the via is created. If it returns nil, the via is not created. The default is t.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "viaEnableUserSkillCallbacks")
envSetVal("layout" "viaEnableUserSkillCallbacks" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "viaEnableUserSkillCallbacks" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

envSetVal("layout" "viaEnableValidPurposes" 'boolean nil)

viaHideEnclosures

layout viaHideEnclosures boolean { t | nil }

Description

Toggles the display of the section in the form that sets the enclosure values in the single mode on the Create Via form. When set to t, the form is expanded and displays the enclosure values. When set ot nil, the enclosure values form is collapsed. The default is t.

Create – Via; Mode: Single

Field

Show Enclosures / Hide Enclosures (Create Via Form)

Examples

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

viaMode

layout viaMode cyclic { Single | Stack | Auto }

Description

Specifies the mode of via creation. Single creates a via. Stack creates a multi-layered via. Auto creates a via and automatically places it on the intersection of two paths. The default is Single.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – Via

Field

Mode (Create Via Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "viaMode")
envSetVal("layout" "viaMode" 'cyclic "Single")
envSetVal("layout" "viaMode" 'cyclic "Stack")
envSetVal("layout" "viaMode" 'cyclic "Auto")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

viaPreventDRCOnOverlap

layout viaPreventDRCOnOverlap boolean { t | nil}

Description

Prevents the creation of auto via on overlap if it introduces DRC violations. When t, auto via is not created on the overlap if DRC violations are introduced. When nil, auto via is created even if DRC violations are introduced on the overlap.

The default is t.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – Via; Mode: Auto

Field

Prevent DRC Violations On The Overlap (Create Via Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "viaPreventDRCOnOverlap")
envSetVal("layout" "viaPreventDRCOnOverlap" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "viaPreventDRCOnOverlap" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

viaPreventDRCWithNeighbors

layout viaPreventDRCWithNeighbors boolean { t | nil}

Description

Prevents the creation of auto via if it introduces DRC violations with neighboring shapes. When t, auto via is not created if DRC violations are introduced with neighboring shapes. When nil, auto via is created even if DRC violations are introduced with the neighboring shapes.

The default is nil.

GUI Equivalent

Command

(In Layout XL) Create – Via; Mode: Auto

Field

Prevent DRC Violations With Neighbors (Create Via Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "viaPreventDRCWithNeighbors")
envSetVal("layout" "viaPreventDRCWithNeighbors" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "viaPreventDRCWithNeighbors" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

viaPrintStatisticsReportByStackDepth

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

viaRows

layout viaRows int any_integer_greater_than_one

Description

Specifies the default number of rows of via to be cut in a via array. The Via Rows field on the Create Via form is updated based on the value you specify in this environment variable. The default number is 1.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – Via; Mode: Single

Field

Rows (Create Via Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "viaRows")
envSetVal("layout" "viaRows" 'int 10)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

viaSelectionMode

layout viaSelectionMode cyclic { unknown | ignoreLayers | useCutLayers | useNonCutLayers }

Description

Controls the selection of vias. You can set the environment variable to one of the following values:

  • unknown: Prevents the selection of vias.
  • ignoreLayers: Enables the selection of vias if the Selectability check box for Vias in the Objects assistant is selected.
  • useCutLayers: Enables the selection of vias if the Selectability check boxes for Vias in the Objects assistant and for the respective cut layer in the Layers assistant are selected.
  • useNonCutLayers: Enables the selection of vias if the Selectability check boxes for Vias in the Objects assistant are selected. Also, both top and bottom layer should be set to visible and at least one bottom or top layer should be selected in the Layers assistant.

The default is ignoreLayers.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "viaSelectionMode ")
envSetVal("layout" "viaSelectionMode " 'cyclic "unknown")
envSetVal("layout" "viaSelectionMode " 'cyclic "ignoreLayers")
envSetVal("layout" "viaSelectionMode " 'cyclic "useCutLayers")
envSetVal("layout" "viaSelectionMode " 'cyclic "useNonCutLayers")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

viaStackColumns

layout viaStackColumns int any_integer_greater_than_one

Specifies the number of columns in the top via of the via stack. The default number is 1.

GUI Equivalent

viaStackSelectionMatchingSizes

Allows to select vias belonging to the same via stack from a set of multiple super-imposed via stacks that share the origin and adjacent layers. The default is nil.

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

viaUseEffectiveCuts

layout viaUseEffectiveCuts boolean { t | nil }

Description

Disables the use of the numCuts parameter on the cutClass definition to optimize the total number of cuts for a via. When this environment variable is set to t, the via engine uses the total cut area for optimization. The default value is t.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "viaUseEffectiveCuts")
envSetVal("layout" "viaUseEffectiveCuts" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "viaUseEffectiveCuts" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

viaUseEntireOverlap

layout viaUseEntireOverlap boolean { t | nil}

Description

Enables you to use the entire overlap to create the via. If t, the entire overlap is used to create the via. If nil, an intersection between the user area and the overlap box is used to create the via.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – Via; Mode: Auto

Field

Use Entire Overlap (Create Via Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "viaUseEntireOverlap")
envSetVal("layout" "viaUseEntireOverlap" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "viaUseEntireOverlap" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

viaUseRowColDefault

layout viaUseRowColDefault boolean { t | nil}

Description

Enables you to manage how to set the values in the Rows and Columns fields in the Create Via form. When t, lets the Create Via form use the edited values. When nil, you can force the rows and columns values by setting values in the environment variables, viaRows and viaColumns.

The default is t.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "viaUseRowColDefault")
envSetVal("layout" "viaUseRowColDefault" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "viaUseRowColDefault" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

viaValidateDRCStandalone

layout viaValidateDRCStandalone boolean { t | nil }

Description

Specifies if the Create Via - Single and Create Via - Stack commands in the Create Via form can create a via with DRC violations. In general, not all metal shapes are present when creating a standalone via, so not all design rules can be checked. The valid values are t and nil. The default value is nil.

GUI Equivalent

None

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "viaValidateDRCStandalone")
envSetVal("layout" "viaValidateDRCStandalone" 'boolean t)
envSetVal("layout" "viaValidateDRCStandalone" 'boolean nil)

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

viaValidPurposes

layout viaValidPurposes string any_valid_purposes

Description

Enables you to specify a list of valid purposes for via creation in automated modes: auto, fast edit, compute from shape: single, compute from shape: stack. The via is not be created even if one purpose of the overlap shapes does not belong to the list of valid purposes specified in this field.

GUI Equivalent

Command

Create – Via; Mode: Auto, Fast Edit; Options

Field

Valid Purposes (Create Via Form)

Examples

envGetVal("layout" "viaValidPurposes")
envSetVal("layout" "viaValidPurposes" 'string "drawing")

Related Topics

List of Layout Editor Environment Variables

Environment Variables Used Internally

The following graphic and layout editor environment variables are used internally by the software or are reserved for future use. Changing the values of these variables may cause the layout editor or other Cadence software to behave improperly or quit. Many of these variables are read-only and cannot be changed.

coalesceLimit

coalesceRatio

confirmDelete

connStatus

criticality

cycleSnap

disableLayerFuncSnapToMfgGrid

eipRedraw

enterFunGravityTypeStr

extractShowDanglingMustConnectInstTerms

extractShowDanglingMustConnectInstTermsOnLayer

figOrder

filteredNetName

grMode

iterNum

jumpersOn

leFigGroupNamePrefix

markerShowIgnore

markNetDumpNetObj

markNetConnectedLayer

markNetStopLayer

markNetViaLayer

markNetHilightObj

midPointOf2TargetsMode

minLabelSize

minRefreshArea

minStippleSize

moreDialogs

netName

outlineOnly

pickNCreate

pinNumBits

probeTextOn

propClass

pruneSize

routeMenuOn

toggle

transformMarkersOn

viewNameList
